column4: I tried to get my wifi up..and it seemed to recognized..but I had wired eth0 set to static ip..so I thought that was the cause of the wifi not working and deleted all settings in my lan sections
going there now...but now I cant even sudu
baxter thats a type but yes I know
when I type sudo I get the msg: sudo: unable to lookup joe-nb via gethostbyname()
(joe-nb is the hostname on my laptop..but as I said I deleted all network settings without realizing what I had done)
ok is that the same as recovery mode?
Thanks Wastrel..coming up in recovery mode now
ok I am there.. /etc/hostname has the name of my notebook (joe-nb)
that is correct.  But is there a line with that name in /etc/hosts?
no..I just did a search on the forums and came up with this link http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=273344&highlight=%2Fetc%2Fhosts
So I am assuming I have to have a line like that in order to sudo aetc?
going to give it a try now
ok Ive changed it so I assume just a reboot is in order?
